column1: #Text=# [Drill-down: Interactive Retrieval of Complex Scenes using Natural Language Queries.]
#Text=Fuwen Tan, Paola Cascante-Bonilla, Xiaoxiao Guo, Hui Wu, Song Feng, Vicente Ordonez.
#Text=This paper explores the task of interactive image retrieval using natural language queries, where a user progressively provides input queries to refine a set of retrieval results.
#Text=Moreover, our work explores this problem in the context of complex image scenes containing multiple objects.

#Text=We propose Drill-down, an effective framework for encoding multiple queries with an efficient compact state representation that significantly extends current methods for single-round image retrieval.
#Text=We show that using multiple rounds of natural language queries as input can be surprisingly effective to find arbitrarily specific images of complex scenes.
#Text=Furthermore, we find that existing image datasets with textual captions can provide a surprisingly effective form of weak supervision for this task.

#Text=We compare our method with existing sequential encoding and embedding networks, demonstrating superior performance on two proposed benchmarks: automatic image retrieval on a simulated scenario that uses region captions as queries, and interactive image retrieval using real queries from human evaluators.
#Text=- Setup a conda environment and install some prerequisite packages like this
#Text=conda create -n retrieval python=3.6    # Create a virtual environment
#Text=conda install jupyter scikit-image cython opencv seaborn nltk pycairo h5py  # Install dependencies
#Text=- Please also install [pytorch](http://pytorch.org/) 1.0 (or higher), torchVision, and torchtext
#Text=- Download the images of the Visual Genome dataset if you have not done so
#Text=This will populate the `DrillDown/data` folder with `vg/VG_100K` and `vg/VG_100K_2`
#Text=- Download the annotations of the images
#Text=This will populate the `DrillDown/data` folder with `vg/sg_xmls` and `vg/rg_jsons`, which are per-image scene-graph and region-graph annotations
#Text=- Download the global image features and region features
#Text=This will populate the `DrillDown/data` folder with `vg/global_features` and `vg/region_36_final`, which are the global features and region features of the images.
#Text=The global features were extracted from a pretrained ResNet101 model.
#Text=The region features were extracted from a pretrained FasterRCNN model provided by https://github.com/peteanderson80/bottom-up-attention.
#Text=Please see `tools/save_image_features.py`, the FasterRCNN repo, and `tools/save_region_features.py` for more details
#Text=This will populate the `DrillDown/data` folder with `caches/image_ckpts` and `caches/region_ckpts`
#Text=The training/evaluation scripts of different models are also included in `.
#Text=Please note that, when finetuning the supervisedly pretrained DrillDown model, e.g. runing the script
